CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The ratios between the hole and electron mobilities were calculated to be 3.2 and 13.6 for the POBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend and the PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend films , respectively. The less balanced carrier transport in the PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend film accounts for the lower FF. The polymers and polymer blend films were also analyzed by X-ray diffraction ( XRD ) studies. Figure 8 shows the XRD patterns of the polymers and the polymer : PC 70 BM blends. All film XRD results were similar and showed weak crystalline features with a broad peak around 23 ° . The crystalline features corresponding to π-stacking among the conjugated polymer backbones were also observed among TT - based polymers ; 25 however , the peaks were broader , and no crystalline peaks were observed at smaller angles around 4.4 ° . This less crystalline feature was possibly caused by the more twisted polymer backbones , as compared to PTB7 or PBDTTPD polymer backbones . In conclusion , we synthesized the low band gap POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers that consist of dialkoxybenzodithiophene ( BDT ) as the donor and N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5azacyclopenta[a]pentalene-4,6-dione ( DTPD ) as the acceptor. The DTPD acceptor moieties allow the POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers to have a low band gap ( ∼ 900 nm ) and optimal HOMO and LUMO levels alignment for PSCs , yielding the PCEs of 4.7 and 5.3% , respectively. In this study , we demonstrate , for the first time , that the DTPD unit is a promising electron - withdrawing building block for low band gap polymers , and it can be utilized to tailor the optical and electronic properties of conjugated polymers for photovoltaic devices and many other applications in plastic electronics.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| POBDTPD |
| PEBDTPD |
| PC 70 BM |
| PTB7 |
| PBDTTPD |

Note that I have presented the entities exactly as they appear in the original paragraph, including any punctuation or capitalization.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| POBDTPD |
| PEBDTPD |

I have removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to "Material Name":

* "polymers"
* "TT"
* "DTPD" (appears twice)
* "PC 70 BM" (already listed under "Material Name")

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Paragraph: The ratios between the hole and electron mobilities were calculated to be 3.2 and 13.6 for the POBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend and the PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend films , respectively. The less balanced carrier transport in the PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend film accounts for the lower FF. The polymers and polymer blend films were also analyzed by X-ray diffraction ( XRD ) studies. This less crystalline feature was possibly caused by the more twisted polymer backbones , as compared to PTB7 or PBDTTPD polymer backbones . In this study , we demonstrate , for the first time , that the DTPD unit is a promising electron - withdrawing building block for low band gap polymers , and it can be utilized to tailor the optical and electronic properties of conjugated polymers for photovoltaic devices and many other applications in plastic electronics.

Sure! Here are the values of the material properties mentioned in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 3.2 | Ratio of hole mobility in POBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend |
| 13.6 | Ratio of electron mobility in POBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend |
| 23 ° | Broad peak angle in XRD patterns of polymers and polymer blends |
| 4.4 ° | Angle of crystalline peaks in XRD patterns of TT-based polymers |
| 900 nm | Band gap of POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers |
| ∼ 900 nm | Optimal HOMO and LUMO levels alignment for PSCs |
| 4.7% | PCE of POBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend |
| 5.3% | PCE of PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend |

Note that some of the values are approximate or given to the nearest degree, as stated in the paragraph.
